Business Problem: Poor sperm DNA integrity reduces IVF success; manual selection inefficient.
Data set used / variable used: Sperm cell images; DNA Fragmentation Index (DFI).
Solution approach: Deep CNN trained to predict DFI from images for quality selection.
Any interesting insights: Identifies top 86th percentile sperm in <10ms per cell, correlates ~0.43 with DNA quality.

Business Problem: Challenges in accurate, scalable sperm selection for ART.
Data set used / variable used: Sperm morphology/motility images from IVF clinics.
Solution approach: AI algorithms for large-data processing and selection.
Any interesting insights: AI potential to outperform traditional methods in consistency.

Business Problem: Enhancing ART success via better sperm selection techniques.
Solution approach: Review of emerging trends like microfluidics and AI sorting.
Any interesting insights: Integrates multiple techniques to mimic female tract stringency.

Business Problem: Need for stringent sperm selection reflecting natural reproduction.
Data set used / variable used: Clinical sperm samples from IVF cycles.
Any interesting insights: Highlights gaps in current methods' physiological mimicry.

Business Problem: Predicting sperm motility and quality for better selection.
Data set used / variable used: Sperm imaging data; motility, morphology metrics.
Solution approach: Deep learning to forecast motility and link to quality.
Any interesting insights: DL aids automated selection in clinical settings.

Research Article URL: Efficacy of Various Sperm Selection Strategies 2
Business Problem: High sperm DNA fragmentation in recurrent pregnancy loss despite normal semen analysis
Data set used / variable used: Semen samples from couples with unexplained recurrent pregnancy loss/ Sperm DNA fragmentation index (DFI), motility
Solution approach: Strategies for selecting sperm with intact DNA integrity
Any interesting insights: Implementing selection reduces DFI risks in ART

Research Article URL: Improving sperm selection strategies for assisted reproduction 3
Business Problem: Male factors in ~50% of infertility cases driving ART use
Data set used / variable used: Semen from infertile males / DNA damage markers, motility
Solution approach: Felix™ device vs. density gradient centrifugation (DGC)
Any interesting insights: Felix™ selects lower DNA damage sperm rapidly, ideal for oligozoospermic cases

Research Article URL: Artificial intelligence for sperm selection—a systematic review 4
Business Problem: Inefficient manual sperm selection in IVF/ICSI
Data set used / variable used: Aggregated from multiple studies on sperm images and videos / Morphology, motility parameters
Solution approach: AI and machine learning models for selection

Business Problem: Apoptotic sperm and DNA fragmentation reducing ART success
Data set used / variable used: Semen samples processed via various methods / Apoptosis markers, DNA fragmentation, motility
Any interesting insights: DGC-MACS lowers fragmentation and oxidative stress for better ICSI

Business Problem: Selecting optimal sperm from 10^8 gametes in male infertility treatments
